subject: Re: [junit] Re: Finding all the tests for a class?
msgSnippet: ... Ah... I like that ... I have always been happy with using suites to run some subset of the tests. But I never found a good solution to the problem of tests
messageBody:
On 11/30/05, Robert Watkins <yahoo@...> wrote:
>
> On 01/12/05, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
> > Test groups to the rescue!
> >
> > So are you going to suggest to create packages "com.foo.fast" and "
> > com.foo.slow" to simulate groups? :-)
>
> No, I use parallel package trees in different root directories. The
> only need to have groups is if you need to have one test belong to
> more than one category, and I personally have yet to experience that
> need.
>

Ah... I like that ... I have always been happy with using suites to run some
subset of the tests.

But I never found a good solution to the problem of tests which fail because
the code to pass them hasn't been written yet (I am talking acceptance tests
here, not developer tests). I have always thought groups would be good for
this... but the separate source tree could work well. I will try that
tomorrow.

Kevin
